alert.note: Alert for Prairie; White; Woodruff (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 23 at 4:37PM CDT until further notice by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Arkansas... White River At Georgetown affecting White, Woodruff and Prairie Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...White River At Georgetown. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 23.0 feet, Minor street flooding in Georgetown including Heath Scott Drive and Riverside Street near the boat ramp. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:00 PM CDT Thursday the stage was 22.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 23.0 feet Saturday, April 01. Additional rises are possible thereafter depending on how much rain occurs. - Flood stage is 21.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecast 7 PM Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun Crest Time Date White River Georgetown 21.0 22.0 Thu 3 PM 21.9 22.3 22.6 23.0 7 PM 4/01 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. River forecasts are based on current conditions and rainfall forecasted to occur over the next 24 hours. During periods of flooding...Evening forecasts are reissued with updated rainfall forecasts. Observed and forecasted stage data plots are available on our Advanced Hydrologic Prediction Service web page at... www.weather.gov/lzk Under the Current Conditions section...Select River and Lakes AHPS.
